results.title: Generation
results.brief_description: This documentary film is about four young teenagers who live in and around Manchester, England. It’s about their lives, their dreams, their aspirations, their alienation, their boredom, their hopelessness and their Saturday nights. Best friends, Fiona Ball and Gaynor McNulty (both aged 17) live in a small village about 40 minutes North East of Manchester. Clubbing for them is the ultimate ritual and the perfect antidote for surviving life in a small town. John McDonald (aged 15) lives on a housing estate in Stockport with his sister (aged 27) and her two young boys. For all of his tough exterior, John is extremely vulnerable and weighed down by feelings of uncertainty and apathy regarding his own future. Hussein Al-Allak (aged 15) lives alone with his mum on a housing estate in suburban Chorlton-Cum-Hardy. In contrast to John, Hussein has a sense of hope and excitement about his future. From these four stories is woven an evocative tableau of life in a northern English city. Includes information sheet. (Awards: Includes Chicago Film Festival, 1997; British Short Film Festival, 1997)

results.title: Gate
results.brief_description: Over the duration of a smoko, 3 sheep station workers (Joel Edgerton, Tony Ryan and Brett Wood) deliberate over which one of them left the gate open and allowed 800 sheep to escape. With remarkable ingenuity and careful questioning, they get to the bottom of the matter.

results.title: Screens and screams
results.brief_description: Kids’ Own Publishing Partnership will have a series of workshops and resultant exhibition which aims : to promote reading including visual literacy, to engage children in the creative process of working together towards a shared outcome, to produce a number of digital stories, to stimulate publishing in schools beyond the boundaries of the project, to extend children’s experience as readers and writers and illustrators.

results.title: Figures in motion
results.creator_credit: Damien Power, Priscilla Collins, AFTRS and Glenn Weller
results.brief_description:
Eadweard Muybridge was the pioneer photographer whose experiments in stop-motion photography helped develop the technology that resulted in motion pictures. In this elegant fictional film, Muybridge forces his young wife to pose nude with his male lover. As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.
Cast: Michael Percival, Lenore Munro, Anthony Cogin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Damien Power, Priscilla Collins, AFTRS and Glenn Weller

results.title: Flying over mother
results.creator_credit: Michael James Rowland, Melanie Coombs and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A Soviet cosmonaut is hurtling through space in a malfunctioning space craft and as he faces his death he remembers his childhood on the Russian steppes where he first became aware of the beauty and miracle of flight. Through the eyes of one individual this delightful Australian short encapsulates the massive movement of modern Russian history from feudal peasantry to technological advancement.

results.title: Letters from Poland
results.brief_description:
In Sydney in 1950 a young Polish woman waits for the arrival of Tadek, her prospective husband. Working as a night cleaner in a city office, she strikes up a casual friendship with the nightwatchman and waits for Tadek.
Cast features Martin Vaughan. Photography and editing by Martha Ansara.

results.title: The Two wheeled time machine
results.brief_description: Henry Howard has discovered a way to stay young forever but life doesn’t seem worth living without his childhood sweetheart, Alice. Risking old age, Henry returns to convince her to join him. Stars Matt Day. Original format 16 mm.

results.title: Two bob mermaid
results.creator_credit: Darlene Johnson, Antonia Barnard and Core Films
results.brief_description: In this visually stunning short film set in the 1950s, a fair-skinned Aboriginal girl gains access to the local swimming pool where Aboriginal people are legally denied access (Source: Australian Screen)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darlene Johnson, Antonia Barnard and Core Films
